]]> Laura Wagner Fisheries Scientist Under Fire For Undisclosed Seafood Industry Funding Ray Hilborn has a reputation for challenging studies showing declines in fish populations. ]]> Clare Leschin-Hoar In 9 Out Of 10 Cities, Middle-Income Families Are Slipping Away A new study by the Pew Research Center shows the share of middle-income households is shrinking. ]]> Marilyn Geewax As Big Candy Ditches GMOs, Sugar Beet Farmers Hit A Sour Patch As companies shun genetically modified ingredients, they're buying more sugar extracted from sugar cane rather than beets. ]]> Alison Kodjak George Zimmerman Attempts To Sell Gun Used To Kill Trayvon Martin For a brief time Thursday, the gun George Zimmerman used to kill Trayvon Martin was up for auction. After outrage, the listing was taken down. Then it was put up for sale again. Zimmerman is the former Florida neighborhood watch volunteer who got into a scuffle with the 17-year-old. He was later acquitted of the killing. Thu, 12 May 2016 16:30:00 -0400 http://www.npr.org/2016/05/12/477835992/george-zimmerman-attempts-to-sell-gun-used-to-kill-trayvon-martin?utm_medium=RSS&utm_campaign=us http://www.npr.org/2016/05/12/477835992/george-zimmerman-attempts-to-sell-gun-used-to-kill-trayvon-martin?utm_medium=RSS&utm_campaign=us For a brief time Thursday, the gun George Zimmerman used to kill Trayvon Martin was up for auction. After outrage, the listing was taken down. Then it was put up for sale again. Zimmerman is the former Florida neighborhood watch volunteer who got into a scuffle with the 17-year-old. He was later acquitted of the killing.

]]> Neda Ulaby White House Request For Emergency Zika Funding Hits Roadblock In Congress The Obama administration requested $1.9 billion in emergency funding to prepare against the Zika virus. Congressional Republicans say the administration doesn't need all that money now and insist the White House is asking for a blank check. ]]> Chris Arnold 'Washington Post' Columnist Literally Eats His Words In Trump Columns <em>The Washington Post's</em> Dana Milbank ate his prior columns in a nine course meal on Thursday. The columns noted that Donald Trump would never become the GOP presidential nominee. Thu, 12 May 2016 16:30:00 -0400 http://www.npr.org/2016/05/12/477835929/washington-post-columnist-literally-eats-his-words-in-trump-columns?utm_medium=RSS&utm_campaign=us http://www.npr.org/2016/05/12/477835929/washington-post-columnist-literally-eats-his-words-in-trump-columns?utm_medium=RSS&utm_campaign=us The Washington Post's Dana Milbank ate his prior columns in a nine course meal on Thursday. ]]> State Religious Freedom Laws Surface In Opposition To Same-Sex Marriage In the year since the Supreme Court legalized same-sex marriage, dozens of religious freedom bills have been filed in state legislatures around the country. The proposals are not meant to limit the court ruling, but rather to protect those who say their religious beliefs do not allow them to work with same-sex couples. Thu, 12 May 2016 16:30:00 -0400 http://www.npr.org/2016/05/12/477835915/state-religious-freedom-laws-surface-in-opposition-to-same-sex-marriage?utm_medium=RSS&utm_campaign=us http://www.npr.org/2016/05/12/477835915/state-religious-freedom-laws-surface-in-opposition-to-same-sex-marriage?utm_medium=RSS&utm_campaign=us In the year since the Supreme Court legalized same-sex marriage, dozens of religious freedom bills have been filed in state legislatures around the country. The proposals are not meant to limit the court ruling, but rather to protect those who say their religious beliefs do not allow them to work with same-sex couples.

]]> Tom Gjelten
